name: Keema Curry
history: Keema Curry, originating from the Indian subcontinent, typically features minced meat cooked with spices. It's a versatile dish that's been adapted in various regions with their unique twists.
description: Keema Curry is a savory and spicy dish made with minced meat (commonly lamb or beef), cooked in a richly spiced gravy with onions, tomatoes, and a variety of aromatic Indian spices.

instructions.title: SautÃ© Onions and Spices
instructions.description: Heat oil in a pan. Add cumin seeds and let them splutter. Add onions and ginger-garlic paste, cooking until onions turn golden.

instructions.title: Cook the Minced Meat
instructions.description: Add minced meat to the pan. Cook until it changes color and is no longer pink.

instructions.title: Add Spices and Tomatoes
instructions.description: Add turmeric, coriander powder, red chili powder, and salt. Cook for a few minutes, then add chopped tomatoes. Cook until tomatoes are soft.

instructions.title: Simmer the Curry
instructions.description: Add water as needed to form a gravy. Bring to a boil, then simmer until the meat is cooked and the gravy is thick.

instructions.title: Add Peas and Garam Masala
instructions.description: Add frozen peas and garam masala to the curry. Cook for an additional 5-7 minutes.

instructions.title: Garnish and Serve
instructions.description: Garnish with chopped coriander leaves. Serve hot with bread or rice.

tips: Use lean minced meat for a healthier version.
Adjust the amount of water depending on the desired consistency of the gravy.
variations: Add a splash of cream for a richer gravy.
Include chopped potatoes for a heartier dish.

storage.shelfLife: Can be refrigerated for up to 2 days.
storage.instructions: Store in an airtight container in the refrigerator.

reheatingInstructions: Reheat on the stove or in a microwave until hot.
presentationTips: Serve in a traditional Indian serving bowl.
Accompany with a side of cucumber salad or raita.
